meanings.definition: In a manner that shows embarrassment or shame
meanings.sent1: She looked abashedly at the ground after spilling her drink.
meanings.sent2: He abashedly apologized for his mistake in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: Abashedly, she realized she had been wearing mismatched socks all day.
meanings.sent4: The puppy abashedly chewed up the new shoes, knowing it was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The student abashedly admitted to not studying for the test, hoping for forgiveness.

meanings.definition: With a feeling of self-consciousness or awkwardness
meanings.sent1: He abashedly avoided eye contact during the awkward silence.
meanings.sent2: She abashedly tripped over her own feet in front of her crush.
meanings.sent3: Abashedly, he tried to dance along but kept stepping on his partner's toes.
meanings.sent4: The comedian abashedly forgot the punchline mid-joke, causing laughter.
meanings.sent5: Feeling abashedly out of place, she stood quietly in the corner at the party.
